Use public transportation: If all bicycles disappeared, one could use public transportation such as buses, trains, or subways to get around. This is a viable option for those who live in urban areas with good public transportation infrastructure. Confidence score: 0.8
Walk or hike: In, one could simply walk or hike to their destination. This is a great option for those who enjoy being active and spending time outdoors. Confidence score: 0.9

Rent a car: If one has the financial means, they could rent a car to get around. This is a viable option for those who need to travel long distances or need to carry a lot of cargo. Confidence score: 0.7
Use a scooter or electric skateboard: These alternative modes of transportation are becoming increasingly popular and can be a great way to get around without a car. Confidence score: 0.6
Use a ridesharing service: Services such as Uber or Lyft can be a convenient way to get around without a car, especially for those who live in urban areas. Confidence score: 0.9
